page.title: 02THE CHURCHES SWAFFAM PRIOR
page.content: The most interesting part about Swaffam Prior are the two churches. Some people think that two sisters who could never get on built their own churches. There were really two parishes and each church was on the edge of each parish. In 979 Byrunoth of East Anglia gave a piece of land to the parish. In 1260 St Gyriac's church was started and in 1450 St Mary's was built. In 1667 the two parishes were reunited. In 1802 the parish decided to rebuild St Gyriac's church and by 1807 it was complete. In more recent years St Gyriacs has been redecorated and is now used for plays, concerts and art and craft displays. In 1983 a porch was added to St Mary's church and now in 1985 both churches retain their full beauty.
